verses.text: And it came to pass \add after\add* many days , that the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came to Elijah in the third year , saying , Go , shew thyself unto Ahab ; and I will send rain upon the earth.
And Elijah went to shew himself unto Ahab. And \add there was\add* a sore famine in Samaria.

And Ahab called Obadiah , which \add was\add* the governor of \add his\add* house. (Now Obadiah feared the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* greatly :\f + \fr 18.3 \ft Obadiah: Heb. Obadiahu\f*\f + \fr 18.3 \ft the governor…: Heb. over his house\f*

For it was \add so\add*, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that Obadiah took an hundred prophets , and hid them by fifty in a cave , and fed them with bread and water.)\f + \fr 18.4 \ft Jezebel: Heb. Izebel\f*

And Ahab said unto Obadiah , Go into the land , unto all fountains of water , and unto all brooks : peradventure we may find grass to save the horses and mules alive , that we lose not all the beasts.\f + \fr 18.5 \ft that…: Heb. that we cut not off ourselves from the beasts\f*
So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself. \p
¶ And as Obadiah was in the way , behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face , and said , \add Art\add* thou that my lord Elijah ?
And he answered him, I \add am:\add* go , tell thy lord , Behold, Elijah \add is here\add*.
And he said , What have I sinned , that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab , to slay me?

\add As\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God liveth , there is no nation or kingdom , whither my lord hath not sent to seek thee: and when they said , \add He is\add* not \add there;\add* he took an oath of the kingdom and nation , that they found thee not.
And now thou sayest , Go , tell thy lord , Behold, Elijah \add is here\add*.

And it shall come to pass, \add as soon as\add* I am gone from thee, that the Spirit of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall carry thee whither I know not; and \add so\add* when I come and tell Ahab , and he cannot find thee, he shall slay me: but I thy servant fear the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* from my youth.

Was it not told my lord what I did when Jezebel slew the prophets of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, how I hid an hundred men of the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* prophets by fifty in a cave , and fed them with bread and water ?
And now thou sayest , Go , tell thy lord , Behold, Elijah \add is here:\add* and he shall slay me.
And Elijah said , \add As\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts liveth , before whom I stand , I will surely shew myself unto him to day.
So Obadiah went to meet Ahab , and told him: and Ahab went to meet Elijah. \p
¶ And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah , that Ahab said unto him, \add Art\add* thou he that troubleth Israel ?
And he answered , I have not troubled Israel ; but thou, and thy father’s house , in that ye have forsaken the commandments of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and thou hast followed Baalim.

Now therefore send , \add and\add* gather to me all Israel unto mount Carmel , and the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty , and the prophets of the groves four hundred , which eat at Jezebel’s table.
So Ahab sent unto all the children of Israel , and gathered the prophets together unto mount Carmel. \p

And Elijah came unto all the people , and said , How long halt ye between two opinions ? if the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add be\add* God , follow him: but if Baal , \add then\add* follow him. And the people answered him not a word.\f + \fr 18.21 \ft opinions: or, thoughts\f*
Then said Elijah unto the people , I, \add even\add* I only, remain a prophet of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; but Baal’s prophets \add are\add* four hundred and fifty men.

Let them therefore give us two bullocks ; and let them choose one bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces , and lay \add it\add* on wood , and put no fire \add under:\add* and I will dress the other bullock , and lay \add it\add* on wood , and put no fire \add under:\add*

And call ye on the name of your gods , and I will call on the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and the God that answereth by fire , let him be God. And all the people answered and said , It is well spoken.\f + \fr 18.24 \ft It is…: Heb. The word is good\f*

And Elijah said unto the prophets of Baal , Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress \add it\add* first ; for ye \add are\add* many ; and call on the name of your gods , but put no fire \add under\add*.

And they took the bullock which was given them, and they dressed \add it\add*, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon , saying , O Baal , hear us. But \add there was\add* no voice , nor any that answered. And they leaped upon the altar which was made.\f + \fr 18.26 \ft hear: or, answer\f*\f + \fr 18.26 \ft answered: or, heard\f*\f + \fr 18.26 \ft leaped…: or, leaped up and down at the altar\f*

And it came to pass at noon , that Elijah mocked them, and said , Cry aloud : for he \add is\add* a god ; either he is talking , or he is pursuing , or he is in a journey , \add or\add* peradventure he sleepeth , and must be awaked.\f + \fr 18.27 \ft aloud: Heb. with a great voice\f*\f + \fr 18.27 \ft he is talking: or, he meditateth\f*\f + \fr 18.27 \ft is pursuing: Heb. hath a pursuit\f*
And they cried aloud , and cut themselves after their manner with knives and lancets , till the blood gushed out upon them.\f + \fr 18.28 \ft the blood…: Heb. poured out blood upon them\f*

And it came to pass, when midday was past , and they prophesied until the \add time\add* of the offering of the \add evening\add* sacrifice , that \add there was\add* neither voice , nor any to answer , nor any that regarded.\f + \fr 18.29 \ft offering: Heb. ascending\f*\f + \fr 18.29 \ft that regarded: Heb. attention\f*
And Elijah said unto all the people , Come near unto me. And all the people came near unto him. And he repaired the altar of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add that was\add* broken down.
And Elijah took twelve stones , according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob , unto whom the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came, saying , Israel shall be thy name :
And with the stones he built an altar in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and he made a trench about the altar , as great as would contain two measures of seed.

And he put the wood in order , and cut the bullock in pieces, and laid \add him\add* on the wood , and said , Fill four barrels with water , and pour \add it\add* on the burnt sacrifice , and on the wood.
And he said , Do \add it\add* the second time. And they did \add it\add* the second time. And he said , Do \add it\add* the third time. And they did \add it\add* the third time.
And the water ran round about the altar ; and he filled the trench also with water.\f + \fr 18.35 \ft ran: Heb. went\f*

And it came to pass at \add the time of\add* the offering of the \add evening\add* sacrifice , that Elijah the prophet came near , and said , \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Abraham , Isaac , and of Israel , let it be known this day that thou \add art\add* God in Israel , and \add that\add* I \add am\add* thy servant , and \add that\add* I have done all these things at thy word.

Hear me, O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, hear me, that this people may know that thou \add art\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God , and \add that\add* thou hast turned their heart back again.

Then the fire of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* fell , and consumed the burnt sacrifice , and the wood , and the stones , and the dust , and licked up the water that \add was\add* in the trench.

And when all the people saw \add it\add*, they fell on their faces : and they said , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, he \add is\add* the God ; the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, he \add is\add* the God.

And Elijah said unto them, Take the prophets of Baal ; let not one of them escape. And they took them: and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon , and slew them there.\f + \fr 18.40 \ft Take: or, Apprehend\f* \p
¶ And Elijah said unto Ahab , Get thee up , eat and drink ; for \add there is\add* a sound of abundance of rain.\f + \fr 18.41 \ft a sound…: or, a sound of a noise of rain\f*
So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel ; and he cast himself down upon the earth , and put his face between his knees ,
And said to his servant , Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up , and looked , and said , \add There is\add* nothing. And he said , Go again seven times.

And it came to pass at the seventh time , that he said , Behold, there ariseth a little cloud out of the sea , like a man’s hand. And he said , Go up , say unto Ahab , Prepare \add thy chariot\add*, and get thee down , that the rain stop thee not.\f + \fr 18.44 \ft Prepare: Heb. Tie, or, Bind\f*
And it came to pass in the mean while , that the heaven was black with clouds and wind , and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode , and went to Jezreel.

And the hand of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was on Elijah ; and he girded up his loins , and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.\f + \fr 18.46 \ft to the…: Heb. till thou come to Jezreel\f*
